Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor for this little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: horseboarder
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews read here on Tripadvisor. They were absolutely spot on. Location was perfect for walking to many places. The nearby cafes were great for breakfast (which was not included with our room reservation). Front desk staff was very helpful - in English. Only tip that I do not recall from other reviews is that room key must be inserted in wall box to make lights in room work. Great for energy savings!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well located hotel near Gare St Lazare”
Reviews.Author: lilywall
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel to be near friends. Our small 6th floor double room (definitely the servants floor when the hotel was built in the 19th century) had everything we needed and the shower room was spacious and well supplied with nice fluffy towels and toiletries. The refurbishment completed last year has been well done and the place feels fresh. This place seems good for business and pleasure - especially shopping. Although it is on a busy street and our room was on the front at the top, we were not troubled by either street or a/c noise. The staff were professsional and very helpful and the location is excellent The only down side was an unexpected meanness in the supply of teabags (just one each of ordinary and mint tea) - a contrast with the 2 shampoos and 2 shoe cleaners in the bathroom. When we asked for one additional bag - we were told that was not possible - by staff who were clearly embarrassed! We suggest people who want to drink tea in their room here bring their own teabags - a small price to pay for an otherwise very decent place. We would happily return to the Atlantic

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in a premium location.”
Reviews.Author: Madisonineurope
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel with a nice staff and a pleasant room. A good find in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Chantaleke
Reviews.Content: Nice room (tiny)- clean bathroom - friendly personnel - breakfast = ok ; We booked with discount offer, but service was nevertheless impeccable.Not noisy. Trainstation with metro accessible on other side of the street. I saw on the photos on the website the works in the hotel were finished. it will be even more agreeable now. Without discount prices are too high.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: UliRichard
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and friendly hotel located near the Metro station for travellers who like to be outside the international hotel chains. I slept very well with windows closed and airconditioning running at medium. However, I was missing free Wifi - you only can login with payed services from Orange.... Also, the bathroom tub was quite open, very difficult to shower and not to make a water-mess....

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ehp_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central close to the metro and to shops, the rooms are a very nice size, I was expecting a tiny room and was pleasantly surprised! The staff is very friendly and were very eager to help with any queries. The one thing to remember is that the hotel has wi-fi but it is not free. Did not try the breakfast but there is an amazing deli on the corner that is very reasonable and has amazing bread and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: shf50
Reviews.Content: We loved our experience at the Atlantic Hotel. We were there for 3 nights. Our room was big - we booked a double room but were given a triple but I think a double would have been fine also. It was very clean and bright, and air conditioned. The bed was very comfortable. The elevator was big enough to fit all of our luggage into. The bathroom was large and had a bathtub. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We did not eat breakfast there - there are so many restaurants near the hotel. We ate at a brasserie directly across the street twice. The food was very good and the prices were reasonable. The location of the hotel was excellent. We got an great price for Paris for the room. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Atlantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, value for money, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gypsysnowy
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel we have stayed in in Paris. It is central (right at the back of Gare St Lazare), good prices (120 euros in June long weekend when french open was on!). The staff are extremely friendly, speak amazing english and are so willing to help. The rooms are modern, clean and secure. It is a 5 min walk from excellent shops. It is much better than i expected it would be, for the price. Definitely stay here if you can!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem - very clean & no smoking!!!”
Reviews.Author: RJB50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over the years and it keeps getting better. They continually upgrade the rooms and the location and price can't be matched. 5 minute walk to major shopping and nearby to several Metro stops. Breakfast was very good. You will not find better value in the 100Euro range!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - a definite recommend.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianKathryn
Reviews.Content: It was easy to get in and out of the Atlantic Hotel; the night guy (Joe, or Joachim) was awesomely helpful in everything from booking shuttles to getting the use of the microwave for baby bottles; the rooms were impeccable and the bathrooms were beautiful. I had a very nice stay and would definitely recommend it. We were there with a group and our baby only woke up others once. The walls are not thick enough for a really screamy baby, though. A few minor drawbacks: only a bath, no shower; the baby crib was somehow broken in the bottom which meant she was sleeping on a slant; it's close to the train but far from the RER; there is no restaurant, only breakfast; the day staff were pretty cold; the breakfast was pretty unhealthy; the room itself was not huge and the only clock was embedded into the TV (pretty small). Altogether, I had a great time and would definitely stay again. The proximity to Gare St. Lazare made it very easy to use the trains in and out of metro Paris.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: purplypooh
Reviews.Content: The room looked clean upon arrival. The next morning, on one of our covers and bed sheets, there were streaks of blood. We had to check if we were bleeding. We weren't, and so we were puzzled where the blood came from. We also saw some black little spots on the bed sheets, but thot it was just from old stains. A little later, my friend started to have red spots all over her arms, and started to itch. We informed the hotel to check, and they steam cleaned the beds. When we came back later in the day, we found bed bugs crawling all over the bed! They must have crawled out after the steam. We demanded for something to be done, but the staff kept telling us they have already cleaned the room. I asked him to come and take a look and he agreed they were bugs. He spoke to the manager who then agreed to give us a new room. The next day when we were checking out, all the manager offered was half the room rate for the last day!!! It was not a compensation at all! When i demanded at least further discount, the manager gave me a very stinking look and very grumpily agreed to give another half a day off. We are still itching today, 4 days after checking out. They insisted this has never happened before, but well, it does now!!! STAY THERE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!! Who knows if the bugs have crawled from that one room to the rest of the rooms!!!! The pathetic discount cannot take away the ugly red bites we have and all the itching we have to tolerate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: miroslavasl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the triple room. The hotel is excellent - clean and quiet! I found it after a very long search on the net. You should have no worries about this hotel. Book it now! The price for the triple room was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for three people”
Reviews.Author: FlaGolf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel near St Lazare train station after using tripadvisor to narrow better Paris hotels down to those that could accommodate triples (in our case, three adults). Overall, we were quiet satisfied with the room comfort (small, as usual for Paris, with a queen and a twin bed), the service, cleanliness, and the decent breakfast. I would note that the bathroom was a super-sized for Paris, though. We got a reasonable deal with breakfast included via the hotel Web site, but I would say there was some confusion about exactly what allowed one to get the best rates on the site (for example, 4 nights for the price of 3, which was advertised). The hotel was kept in good condition throughout, and the quiet AC was a real winner since Paris was hot that week and there was a fair amount of street noise. All desk and other personnel were friendly and willing to help in any way possible (communicating with some mixture of our French and their English, neither great). Note that the elevator is tiny, and this would not be good for wheelchair- bound folks. Being near the station was not really much of a help as the station itself does not connect to any major sights or international connections, but there was an associated Metro nearby that could get you anywhere quickly. It was a quick taxi ride to Gare du Nord, also, where you can connect to Eurostar, Thalys, etc. There is a small reasonably priced fruit stand and snack shop right across the street. There are several restaurants and cafes in the area which were serviceable. I would have given an overall 4 for the hotel if not for a huge problem that arose: the hotel internet service (Swisscom, a pretty common wi-fi provider in Europe) stopped working the first day and still was not fixed when we left 3 days later. The staff were apologetic, but someone really dropped the ball on this one given the absolute need for internet access these days to check emails, buy tickets, call overseas phones, etc. It was possible to get some wi-fi service via a cafe nearby, but it was limited one short session per day and pretty flaky. I down-rated on service due to the wi-fi problem only.

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: yatraman
Reviews.Content: its a cozy hotel great bakery on the corner about a minute away

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kat_April08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and comfortable. Plenty of room for two people for a few nights. Great shower and spacious bathroom. A few Metros nearby to choose from. The evening receptionist was particularly helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good staying here”
Reviews.Author: _sv0b0da_
Reviews.Content: After long search for the hotel we selected Atlantic as a hotel with a larger rooms in comparison with what we saw in the catalogues for some other hotels. And in reality we weren’t disappointed with how room look and covered. We got bright light room in yellow, exactly as it was in the catalogue. The bathroom was very clean and the personnel cleaned it every day. Location of the hotel is also good and near one of the metro station. Near hotel there are restaurants and bars as well as small store with fresh fruits and vegetables and other products just on opposite site from the hotel. At the same time for the people who are very sensitive to the noise we would recomend to book rooms on higher floor if possible. Since you can really hear and feel a metro in the late evening. The breakfast was also nice and with big but usual selection: different type of bread, egg, honey, jam, cheese, ham, jogurt, juice, etc. The personnel always at the begining was asking what we would drink tee or coffee. The breakfast room is of average size but not enough for all hotel guests. But it was only one time that we had bad luck and bad time to wait for a place there. Usually, the people quickly changed each other and there were always some free places to sit. People on reception were helpful and spoke also english.

Reviews.Title: “Paris weekend”
Reviews.Author: LittleNDrogheda
Reviews.Content: A small, friendly hotel.Good central location. The room and bathroom were clean and bright and more than adequate for a short stay break. Breakfast in bed was served promptly at the requested time and as continental breakfasts go was more than adequate to fuel a day of sightseeing. The only fault I could report on was that the walls between rooms seemed rather thin and at times you could be aware of the nearness of fellow guests. Luckily we were all fairly quiet and well-behaved otherwise I would imagain this could be a major problem! A good choice for a short stay break because of its location, cleanliness ,nearness to Metro , surrounding small restaurants and its friendly staff make this hotel a worthwhile consideration .

HotelInfo.Name: Atlantic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 44, Rue de Londres | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
